) This IRM section provides the instructions for the use of Reporting Agents (RAF) Inquiry command codes RFINK and RAFR and (
) Purpos
hese sections provide instructions for inputting information to research the RAF database. (
) Audience:IRS Tax Technicians and Account Management employees. (
) Policy Owner
he Director, W&I owns the polices contained herein (
) Program Owners: Wage & Investment (W&I) is responsible for the tion, procedures, and updates related to the program (

) Primary Stakeholders : Wage & Investment (W&I), Large Business and national (LB&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB&SE), Tax exempt and Government Entities (TE&GE), and Enterprise Operations (EOPS) (
) Program Goal
hese are the instructions for using the RAF Add and IDRS command codes (

) Reporting Agents File (RAF) is a computerized system of records which houses both the Reporting Agent Records and the Taxpayer/Client Records. Reporting Agents (RA) are authorized by their clients (BMF taxpayers) via Form
to electronically deposit employment taxes and e-ﬁle tax returns o(n their behalf, as well as exchange other information with IRS on their behalf. (
) Form

, referred to as the “Reporting Agent Authorization”, is what the relationship between the business and the third party. By signing this the business taxpayer authorizes a reporting agent to sign and ﬁle speciﬁc business return forms as well as make federal tax deposits (FTDs) and tax payments (FTPs) on behalf of the business. (
) Only Reporting Agents have authorization authority to sign and ﬁle Federal Employment Tax Returns (

) The RAF database also contains: • Taxpayer Information • Reporting Agent Information • Reporting Agent Authorizations • Authorization Agreements • Notice Indicator • Source Document Locator Number (SDLN) • MFT and Tax Period (
) Users of the RAF command codes are responsible for the information the RAF database. Certain actions may cause unpostable conditions that need corrective actions taken.
This IRM section provides the instructions for the use of Reporting Agents File (RAF) Inquiry command codes RFINK and RAFR

Command Code Deﬁnitions RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, and AFUPT are all command codes that will ADD or UPDATE a Taxpayer and the Reporting Agent whom they are granting authorizations to in the RAF databse. The Inquiry command codes are prerequisites for these RAF add and update command codes. RFMRG is used to merge two Reporting Agents into one.

Word or acronym: Meaning Example of use AFADT Input Command Add the EIN name Code Screen and address of the ﬁler onto RAF database AFUPT Input Command Change Reporting Code Screen Agent information and add comments BMF Business Master File The BMF dtat can be accessed online cc/CC Command Code Use to speed up pro- cessing time when entering data onto RAF DB2 The type of database The RAF database is RAF exits on IBM DB2 one EIN Employer Identiﬁca- The business tion Number Taxpayer identiﬁer is called an EIN EPMF Employee Plan EPMF contains Master File various employer plans used for their employees EXT Extension number The telephone used with a number was 123-45- telephone number 6789 with an ext of 123 ID Identiﬁcation An SSN and EIN are identiﬁcation numbers IDRS Integration Data IDRS only contains Retrieval System accounts being worked on not all the accounts being maintain by IRS MFT Master File Tax code The taxpayer used Form 1040 which is MFT-30
Command Codes RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG 2.4.40

2.4.40 MF TRANS Master File Transac- By entering an Autho- tion rization on the database often cause a MF transaction being sent to the IDRS Master File N/C Name Control The name control is usually the ﬁrst 4 characters of the Tax- payer’s BMF name NAP National Account We check the NAP for Proﬁle every Taxpayer. RAF Reporting Agent File The database that stores the Reporting Agent tax returns RAL Reporting Agent List Accompanying Forms 8655 RFINK Research Command Use to search RAF Code database for Reporting Agent Au- thorization RFINKR Research Command Use to search RAF Code database for Reporting Agents. RFRMA Command Code Use to input screen Reporting Agent Au- thorization onto RAF database RFRMAT Command Code Used to retrieve and screen change Reporting Agent information RFRTM Command Code Used to retrieve and screen change Authorization on RAF database RFRTMT Command Code Used to retrieve and screen change Taxpayer in- formation on RAF database TC Transaction Code 960 and 961 Code that is use to send Transactions to Master File UPC Unpostable code 960 Transaction code that send a un- postable transaction.
IDRS Terminal (

) The Reporting Agents File contains information regarding the type of tion that Taxpayers have given to their Reporting Agent for the employment modules and/or the payment modules in their account. This authorization allows the Reporting Agent to ﬁle the Taxpayers Forms
or
on magnetic tape or electronically, ﬁle other forms as shown on the form

, make magnetic tape or electronic submission of federal tax deposits. The mation from the authorization is used to direct copies of notices and correspondence to Reporting Agents when this has been authorized. It can also be used to determine whether an individual claiming to be a Reporting Agent for a Taxpayer is, in fact, authorized to receive the information he/she requests. There are seven command codes needed to update the RAF, RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG ( See IRM
). These command codes can only be used by the RAF Team in Ogden, Utah. They are the only RAF unit currently allowed to perform adds, updates, and deletes within the RAF Database. (
) The RAF Database resides at the Enterprise Computing (

) Authorizations on the RAF are recorded by the type of tax (MFT Code, Deﬁner, and Payment Indicator). They contain the Tax Period for which the Reporting Agent Authorization began. The authorizations remain in effect that tax period until they are revoked, terminated by the Taxpayer, or termi- nated by the IRS. (
) Transactions are generated to the Master Files to update the RAF which is carried on the entity record for the Taxpayer. THE VALUES OF THE RAF INDICATORS ARE::
No authorization on ﬁle
Authorization on ﬁle THE VALUES OF THE RAF TRANSACTION CODES ARE: : TC Will be generated to set the RAF Indicators On. (Value
TC Will be generated to set the RAF Indicators Off. (Value

) Currently, RAF Transactions are sent to Master File from the Ogden RAF Team. When RAF Transactions do not post at Master File, an unpostable listing will be generated. This listing will contain unresolved RAF and should be worked by the unit responsible for RAF. (
) The unpostable codes can be researched by using the common research available. These include the RAF command code RFINK ( IRM
), command code ENMOD and ordering MFTRA transcripts. (
) When unpostable codes
and
are generated, research codes to determine how to resolve them and make appropriate corrections RAF via CC RFUPT. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

or

The mation from the authorization is used to direct copies of notices and correspondence to Reporting Agents when this has been authorized. It can also be used to determine whether an individual claiming to be a Reporting Agent for a Taxpayer is, in fact, authorized to receive the information he/she requests. There are seven command codes needed to update the RAF, RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG ( See IRM
). These command codes can only be used by the RAF Team in Ogden, Utah. They are the only RAF unit currently allowed to perform adds, updates, and deletes within the RAF Database.

, Reporting Agent Authorization, for a Taxpayer is needed, request should be made to the Ogden RAF Team. The RAF Team will pull document by Reporting Agent and received date. (
) RFRTMv—used to request the format CC’s RFADD and RFUPT. (See

). This command code must be preceded by CC RFINK. ( IRM Codes for a complete description of CC RFINK which is used to research the a. RFRTM[slashb] - gives RFADD[M ] and RFADD[T] based on which accounts CC RFINK found on the ﬁle. ( IRM
for a complete scription of CC RFINK which is used to research the RAF.) b. RFRTM[T] - gives RFUPT[T] format. (

) RFADDv — used to add or modify authorization information on the RAF This command code must be preceded by CC RFRTM [slashb]. a. RFADD[M] — This command code is used to add, revoke, end date, delete modules to Taxpayer information already on the RAF. It is also used to update the W
and
indicators. b. RFADD[T] — This command code is used to add new Taxpayer tion on the RAF. (
) RFUPT[T] — This command code is used to update Taxpayer information the RAF. This command code must be preceded by CC RFRTM. [T] (
) RFRMAv—used to request the format CC’s AFADT, AFUPT and RFMRG. Exhibit
). This command code must be preceded by CC RFINK. (
for a complete description of CC RFINK which is used to research RAF.) a. RFRMA[slashb] - gives AFADT based on which accounts CC RFINK found on the ﬁle. ( IRM
for a complete description of CC which is used to research the RAF.) b. RFRTM[T] - gives AFUPT format. c. RFRTM[A]- gives RFMRG format. (
) AFADT - This command code is used to add new Reporting Agents on the RAF. (
) AFUPT - This command code is used to modify Reporting Agents on the RAF. (
) RFMRG - This command code is used to merge the Taxpayers of one Reporting Agent with another Reporting Agent and its Taxpayers, once approved. (

RFADDv — used to add or modify authorization information on the RAF ﬁle. This command code must be preceded by CC RFRTM [slashb].
The following table lists the error messages for CC RFRTM[slashb]:

CC RFRTM[slashb] ERROR MESSAGES (displayed on line 24) DEFINER INVALID The input command code deﬁner was not [slashb] or T. Correct and re-enter INPUT PREREQ COMMAND RFRTM must be preceded by CC CODE-CC RFINK.Reinitialize. INVALID COMMAND CODE The input command code is invalid. Correct and re-enter. EIN INFORMATION MISSING —If CC RFRTM is input with deﬁner [slashb], both Taxpayer and Reporting Agent EINs must be input with CC RFRTM. If CC RFRTM is input with deﬁner T, the Taxpayer EIN must have been input with CC RFINK. Reinitialize. (Begin again with CC RFINK) N/R TXPYR-RA NOT ON RAF No record of Taxpayer was found and no Reporting Agent information was found on RAF. Reporting Agent must be present on RAF. T/P ON RAF-RA NOT ON CC RFRTM was input with deﬁner RAF [slashb], when the preceding CC RFINK was input, no record of the Reporting Agent was found on RAF. CC RFRTMT and RFUPTT can be used to make changes to Taxpayer record. Reporting Agent must be on RAF to proceed with RFRTM[slashb]. (2) Valid Response for CC RFRTM [slashb] — The appropriate screen format will displayed.

The following table lists the error messages for CC RFADD[M]:

CC RFADD[M] ERROR MESSAGES (displayed on line 24) Invalid or inconsistent ﬁelds are followed by asterisks. If an asterisk follows an item, that item has been entered incorrectly. DATABASE ERROR A problem occurred while attempting REENTER to access the database. This may be a system error; attempt to re-input. If error recurs, notify Computer Branch. DEFINER INFO CHANGED, The deﬁner brought to the screen by RESTART CC RFADD[M] has been altered. Begin again with CC RFINK. DUPLICATE MFT CDS The same MFT/Deﬁner/Payment TRANS INPUT Type was entered on the screen more than once. Remove the dupli- cates and reenter. INITIALIZATION INVALID CC RFADD[M] was not preceded by CC RFADD[M] Reinitialize. MFT/DEFINER//TAX PERIOD/ An attempt was made to delete au- PAYMENT TYPE NOT thorizations for an MFT/Deﬁner/Tax PRESENT ON RAF Period/Payment Type that is not on the RAF ﬁle for this Taxpayer. Research further to determine proper action. NO AUTHORIZATIONS No prior authorizations are on the PRESENT FOR REVOKE RAF ﬁle for this Taxpayer. New au- thorizations should be added using Current Action Code of A. NO RA ON FILE There is no Reporting Agent on ﬁle whose EIN matches the Agent EIN input. Check the number and reenter. NO TAX MODULES INPUT No information for a speciﬁc MFT/ Deﬁner//Tax Period/Payment Indicator has been input on the ﬁrst screen line reserved for this informa- tion. If there is no information on the screen, put in the necessary and reenter. If there is a blank line before the line of input, move the informa- tion up to the proper line and reenter. PLEASE CORRECT INCON- Two or more data elements are in- SISTENT DATA consistent. Correct the items identiﬁed with asterisks and reenter. The following are the inconsistencies which will generate these messages: 1. Tax Period/MFT 2. CC Deﬁner/Current Action Code

Command Codes RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG 2.4.40

RFMRG 2.4.40 page 9 CC RFADD[M] ERROR MESSAGES (displayed on line 24) Invalid or inconsistent ﬁelds are followed by asterisks. If an asterisk follows an item, that item has been entered incorrectly. PLEASE CORRECT INVALID One or more data elements is/are DATA invalid. Correct the item(s) identiﬁed with an asterisk(s) and reenter. RA EIN INVALID The Reporting Agent EIN input with CC RFADD[M] differs from the screen generated Agent EIN. If the Agent EIN generated on the screen is correct, restore it to the screen and reenter; otherwise, begin again with CC RFINK. RA N/C INVALID The Reporting Agent Name control input does not match the Agent Name Control on the RAF ﬁle. Correct and reenter. RA NOT PRESENT FOR No data is currently present on the MFT/DEFINER/TAX PRD/ RAF ﬁle for this Reporting Agent for PAYMENT TYPE this module, but Action Code D (delete) was input. RCVD DATE INCONSISTENT The Received Date of the action FOR DEL/REV input to delete or revoke a module precedes the Received Date of the module already on ﬁle. Correct the Received Date and Reenter. OLD SEQUENCE NUMBER Old Sequence Number entered but not re-entered for conﬁrmation. SEQUENCE ACTION The Sequence Action Indicator ADD INDICATOR INVALID or DELETE or REVOKE or END DATE must be a 1. Correct and reenter. THIS MFT CD/DEFINER/TAX An attempt was made to add a PERIOD/PAYMENT TYPE module for an MFT CD/Deﬁner/Tax ALREADY ON FILE Period/Payment Type which already exists for a Taxpayer. On the RAF ﬁle, a Taxpayer is allowed only one module for each MFT CD/Deﬁner/Tax Period (Exception, one of the two modules is for a payment). The existing module must be deleted and the new module added, or the new module may be entered with a revoke.

Correct and reenter. No data is currently present on the RAF ﬁle for this Reporting Agent for this module, but Action Code D (delete) was input. The Received Date of the action input to delete or revoke a module precedes the Received Date of the module already on ﬁle. Correct the Received Date and Reenter. Old Sequence Number entered but not re-entered for conﬁrmation. The Sequence Action Indicator ADD or DELETE or REVOKE or END DATE must be a

Correct and reenter. An attempt was made to add a module for an MFT CD/Deﬁner/Tax Period/Payment Type which already exists for a Taxpayer. On the RAF ﬁle, a Taxpayer is allowed only one module for each MFT CD/Deﬁner/Tax Period (Exception, one of the two modules is for a payment). The existing module must be deleted and the new module added, or the new module may be entered with a revoke.

An attempt was made to add a module for an MFT CD/Deﬁner/Tax Period/Payment Type which already exists for a Taxpayer. On the RAF ﬁle, a Taxpayer is allowed only one module for each MFT CD/Deﬁner/Tax Period (Exception, one of the two modules is for a payment). The existing module must be deleted and the new module added, or the new module may be entered with a revoke.

CC RFADD[M] ERROR MESSAGES (displayed on line 24) Invalid or inconsistent ﬁelds are followed by asterisks. If an asterisk follows an item, that item has been entered incorrectly. TXPYR-EIN-INVALID The Taxpayer EIN input with CC RFADD[M] differs from the EIN generated on the screen format. If the EIN generated is correct, restore it to the screen and reenter. Otherwise, begin again with CC RFINK. TXPYR N/C INVALID The Taxpayer Name Control input does not match the Taxpayer Name Control on the RAF ﬁle. Correct and reenter. TXPYR NOT ON FILE The Taxpayer EIN input on the screen does not currently exist on the RAF ﬁle. Begin again with CC RFINK to get the proper screen format for a new Taxpayer record. MORE THAN ONE CORP- Screen input has more than one of EFTPS MFT the following forms, 1041, 1120, 990C, 990T, 990PF. A CORP-EFTPS MFT Screen input has one of the corp- ALREADY ON FILE eftps forms and the database already shows one present.

RFMRG 2.4.40 page 13 CC RFUPT[T] ERROR MESSAGES (DISPLAYED ON LINE 24) CHANGE DATA NOT No change data is present on the PRESENT screen. INITIALIZATION INVALID CC RFUPT[T] was not preceded by CC RFRTM[T]. Reinitialize TXPYR N/C INVALID The Taxpayer Name Control input does not match the Name Control on the RAF ﬁle for the Taxpayer. Correct and reenter. NEW EIN PRESENT ON RAF The new EIN entered on the screen is currently on the RAF ﬁle. This could mean the Taxpayer is on the ﬁle under both numbers. Research to determine correct number. TXPYR EIN INVALID The Taxpayer EIN input on the screen differs from the EIN generated on the screen format. If the EIN generated on the screen format is correct, restore it to the screen and reenter. Otherwise, reini- tialize, using the correct Taxpayer EIN. DEFINER INFO CHANGED The deﬁner brought to the screen by RESTART CC RFRTM has been altered. Begin again with CC RFINK. PLEASE CORRECT INCON- One or more data elements are in- SISTENT DATA consistent. Correct the items identiﬁed with asterisks and reenter. The following are the inconsistencies which will generate these messages. 1. New Taxpayer Name 2. New Taxpayer Name Control TC960 HAS NOT BEEN After the transaction is returned, if SENT TO MF they don’t match, RAF unit has to change information on MF and set the TC96X to 0, send again. (2) Valid Response — The message “ REQUEST COMPLETED” with new sequence number will be displayed on line 24

CC RFADD[T], RFUPT[T] NAP ERROR MESSAGES INVALID OR INCONSISTENT FIELDS TXPYR NOT ON FILE The Taxpayer EIN could not be matched against the National Accounts Proﬁle (NAP) Database. Check to make sure the EIN is correct. If it is, this message means that this Taxpayer is not yet on the Master File. NAME CTRL MISMATCH ON The Name Control input does not MF match on the NAP Database. Use the correct Name Control provided by Master File and reenter. INVALID EIN TYPE or The TIN TYPE code or MASTER MASTER FILE SOURCE ON FILE SOURCE code is not valid. The NAP REQUEST REC NAP request cannot be completed. This response indicates a program error—notify the IDRS Control Staff. NAPAREA NOT AVAILABLE The NAP area of the Database that houses the requested EIN is down. CRS/NAP ACCESS NOT The Communication Replacement AVAILABLE System (CRS) for the NAP is not available at the time. Processing of this account cannot continue. NATIONAL ENTITY FILE NOT The NAP is unavailable at this time. AVAILABLE TRY LATER Processing cannot continue. NAP NOT AVAILABLE NAP is not available at this time. Pro- BYPASS ON cessing cannot continue, try again later.

If CC RFRMA is input with deﬁner T, the Reporting Agent EIN must have been input with CC RFINK[R]. Reinitialize. (Begin again with CC RFINK[R]) RA NOT ON RAF No record of Reporting Agent found on RAF. Reporting Agent must be present on RAF.

CC RFRMA[T] ERROR MESSAGES (displayed on line 24) DEFINER INVALID The input command code deﬁner was not [slashb], T, or A. Correct and re-enter INPUT PREREQ COMMAND RFRMA must be preceded by CC CODE-CC RFINK[R].Reinitialize. INVALID COMMAND CODE The input command code is invalid. Correct and re-enter. EIN INFORMATION MISSING —If CC RFRMA is input with deﬁner [slashb], Reporting Agent EIN must be input with CC RFRMA. If CC RFRMA is input with deﬁner T, the Reporting Agent EIN must have been input with CC RFINK[R]. Reinitialize. (Begin again with CC RFINK[R]) RA NOT ON RAF No record of Reporting Agent found on RAF. Reporting Agent must be present on RAF.

The received date must be all numeric It must be no later than the current date. If no date is available, enter the current date.

9 5 45 - 48 W2-YearYYYY-Year Authorization given. 10 5 60 - 63 1099-YearYYYY-Year Authorization given. 11 5 75 - 78 3921 & 3922-Year YYYY - Year Authorization given. 12 8 - 19 1 - 2 MFT. Enter with 01, 02, 03, 05, 09, 10, 11, 14, 16, 12, 33, 34, or 44. 13 8 - 19 9 - 10 Form Deﬁner. Enter Blank, PR, SS, C, T, or PF. 14 8 - 19 18 - 21 Tax Period. Enter the year speciﬁed by the Taxpayer if the authoriza- tion is for a return module as follows: MFT-CD of 01, the Year 1969 or later. MFT-CD of 09, the year 1962 or later. MFT-CD of 10, the Year 1986 or later. MFT-CD of 11, the year 1961 or later. MFT-CD of 12, the year 1985 or later. MFT-CD of 14, the year 2006 or later. MFT-CD of 16, the year 1994 or later. For payment authorizations any year is valid.

For MFT-CD of 01, the Month 03, 06, 09, or 12 if the authorization is for a return module. For MFT-CD for a payment module any month 01–12 is valid. 16 8 - 19 46 Notice Indicator. Enter 1 if the Reporting Agent is authorized to receive notices directed to this Taxpayer. 17 8 - 19 56 Payment Indicator. Enter P if the Reporting Agent is authorized to make Deposits and Payments or Blank if the Reporting Agent is au- thorized to Sign & File returns. 18 22 1 - 38 The message “ Primary name is” will be displayed. 19 23 1 - 38 If valid, Taxpayer’s name from NAP will be displayed. 20 24 1 - 38 Error Message 21 24 56 - 72 New Sequence Number - This is displayed if the transaction is completed.

Command Codes RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG 2.4.40 page

This format is generated in response to RFRTM[slashb] when records for both Taxpayer and Reporting Agent were found with CC RFINK . The Reporting Agent may be given an authorization for the ﬁrst time using this command code or the authorization the Reporting Agent already has may be updated or revoked or deleted.

When making a tax module change to correct an unpostable condition (UPC 324-Inconsistent ﬁling requirement and RAF Indicator) a. If the Taxpayer has a module for a 941 but it should be a 940 (or vice versa), the module can be changed by deleting the OLD and adding the NEW module. The Daily program will send a TC96X to Master File. b. If the Taxpayer has a module for a 940 or a 941 and it should be end dated use RFADD(M). c. If the Taxpayer has one module and needs another one added use RFADD(M) to add the second module. The Daily program will send a TC96X to Master File. d. If the Taxpayer has two modules and one should be deleted use RFADD(M) to delete a module. The Daily program will send a TC96X to Master File.
(a) CC RFADD[M] Input Format
(b) Record Element Description—the validity checks described for the various elements in the discussion of CC RFADD[T] must be met for the corresponding elements input with this command code.

The received date must be all numeric. It must be no later than the current date. If no date is available,

Enter Blank, PR, SS, T, or PF. 14 8 - 19 16 - 19 Tax Period Year. Enter the Year. 15 8 - 19 27 - 28 Tax Period Month. Enter the Month. 16 8 - 19 36 Notice Indicator. Enter 1 if the Reporting Agent is authorized to receive notices directed to this Taxpayer. 17 8 - 19 43 Payment Indicator. Enter P if the Reporting Agent is authorized to make Deposits and Payments or Blank if the Reporting Agent is authorized to Sign & File returns. 18 8 - 19 58 Current Action Code — For ADD/REVOKE, enter with 1 to add a module or to revoke existing module(s) and add the new module(s) entered. If a action code for a delete or end date is entered, it would be unacceptable. See Note below. 29 8 - 19 65 End Date. Enter 1 to end date a module. 20 8 - 19 73 Delete. Example 1: A Taxpayer has two modules, MFT 01 198503 and MFT 10 198612, both with Agent A. To add the two new modules with Reporting Agent B, input:
Reporting Agent B’s EIN MFT:
TAX PERIOD YEAR:
MONTH:
PAYMENT: ADD/REV:
END DATE: DELETE: MFT:
FORM: TAX PERIOD YEAR:
MONTH:
PAYMENT: ADD/REV:
END DATE: DELETE: The Taxpayer will now have these authorizations:
Agent A
Agent A will now show as revoked. It has been end dated.
Agent B
Agent B
The Taxpayer will now have these authorizations:
Agent A
Agent A will now show as revoked. It has been end dated.
Agent B
Agent B

The previous modules with matching MFT, FORM, and PAYMENT information will be revoked automati- cally when the new module information is added. If only one new module is entered, only the module with matching MFT, FORM, and PAYMENT information will be revoked by the new module being added. As you see, any other active authorization modules will remain active.
Example 2: In the example above, change the other authorization to Reporting Agent B. Doing so automatically revoke the MFT 01 198503 authorization with Agent A. To do this, input:
The Taxpayer will now have these authorizations:
Agent A will now show as revoked. It has been end dated.
Agent A will now show as revoked. It has been end dated.
Agent B
Agent B
Now the authorizations for both the MFT 01 and the MFT 10 have been revoked with Agent A and granted to Agent B.

Exhibit 2.4.40-7 (Cont. 1) (01-01-2010) CC RFUPT[T] — Format Display

Item Line Position Description and Validity 1 1 1 - 6 CC RFUPT with deﬁner T. 2 1 18 - 27 Taxpayer EIN. 3 1 46 - 49 Taxpayer Current Name Control will be displayed. 4 2 46 - 80 Taxpayer Current Primary Name will be displayed. 5 6 18 - 27 Taxpayer New EIN — Optional. See Note below. 6 6 46 - 49 Taxpayer New Name Control — Optional. Usually the ﬁrst four characters of the Taxpayer’s Primary name. 7 7 46 - 49 Taxpayer New Primary Name — Optional. 35 Characters maximum. 8 9 62 Master File Posting Indicator — Optional. Used in 2 instances: (1) To correct an unpostable resulting from an EIN or name mismatch. (2) To send a copy of a existing Taxpayer authorizations to post at Master File. (1) To correct an unpostable resulting from an EIN or name mismatch, input the EIN or name change and request a TC960 by entering a ’Y’. (2) To send a copy of an existing Taxpayer authorizations to post at Master File, simply request a TC960 by entering a ’Y’. Whether a transaction has previously posted at Master File or not is no longer of interest. Adds and Updates are now both TC960 transactions. 8 24 1 - 38 Request Status Message

This command code requests the format for CC RFMRG . This command is used to merge the Taxpayers of one Reporting Agent with another Reporting Agent
(a) CC RFMRG Input Format

Item Line Position Description and Validity 1 1 1 - 5 CC RFMRG 2 1 18 - 27 Reporting Agent (old) EIN. Must be in nn-nnnnnnn format, must be numeric, and cannot be all nine’s or all zeroes. 3 2 18 - 27 Reporting Agent (new) EIN. Must be in nn-nnnnnnn format, must be numeric, and cannot be all nine’s or all zeroes. 4 24 1 - 38 Error Message
NOTE - Caution must be taken when entering old and new Reporting Agents EIN.Once action is complete all the Taxpayers of the old agent will be immediately moved to the new agent.
